name: chauvinistically
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
politics in a way that shows an unreasonable belief that your own country or race is the best or most important: The team urged the crowd to react as loudly and as chauvinistically as they could. The community is chauvinistically resistant to change.
in a way that shows a belief that women are naturally less important, intelligent, or able than men: Her contributions were chauvinistically ignored by other computer scientists. The men chauvinistically expected the women to cook dinner. See
chauvinist
More examplesFewer examplesChauvinistically, I am also worried that one of our major corporate citizens is leaving the city.Competitive cycling was for a long time chauvinistically European.Truck drivers were chauvinistically honking their horns at women motorists.
